citation.article-title: Actinomadura miaoliensis sp. nov., a thermotolerant polyester-degrading actinomycete.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Actinomadura miaoliensis sp. nov.
Actinomadura miaoliensis (mi.ao.li.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. miaoliensis of Miaoli county, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-positive, aerobic, non-acid–alcohol-fast and thermotolerant.
Short spore chains are borne on the tips of aerial mycelium.
Spores are round, 1 μm in diameter, spiny and non-motile.
Glucose, xylose, rhamnose, sorbitol, fructose, trehalose and lactose can be utilized, but inositol, arabinose, galactose and inulin are not utilized.
Madurose, glucose and galactose are detected in whole-cell hydrolysates.
Predominant menaquinones are MK-9(H4) and MK-9(H2).
The diagnostic phospholipids are diphosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylinositol.
Major cellular fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0, C16 : 0, C17 : 0 and 10-methyl-C17 : 0.
The type strain is BC 44T-5T (=FIRDI 002T=BCRC 16873T=LMG 24335T), isolated from soil collected from Miaoli, Taiwan.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 70.6 mol%.
